command: python3 -c "import boto3, json; iam=boto3.client('iam'); user='alex.research'; iam.put_user_permissions_boundary(UserName=user, PermissionsBoundary='arn:aws:iam::aws:policy/job-function/ViewOnlyAccess'); iam.tag_user(UserName=user, Tags=[{'Key':'Manager','Value':'c.nguyen'},{'Key':'Location','Value':'Remote-US'},{'Key':'Onboarded','Value':'2025-09-01'}]); print(json.dumps({'action':'harden_persona_boundaries','user':user,'permissions_boundary':'job-function/ViewOnlyAccess','tags_added':['Manager','Location','Onboarded']}))"
explanation: Sets a permissions boundary and realistic HR-style tags to keep the persona believable and constrained.
rationale_steps: Use a permissions boundary to mimic guardrails typical of contractor accounts.
Add HR-style tags that align with onboarding processes and directory data.
